    1414= Task 1: Create a MySQL Database =

    16 * Download a MySQL database for your development machine from [http://dev.mysql.com/downloads/mysql/ http://dev.mysql.com/downloads/mysql/];
    17 * Create a database called "moviedb" with the following tables:[[BR]]
     15 * Download a MySQL database for your development machine from http://dev.mysql.com/downloads/mysql/;
     16 * Create a database called "moviedb" with the following tables:[[BR]]

    2928The table-creation SQL statements should be written in a '''createtable.sql''' file.  All varchar() fields for which there is no data (i.e., the fields contents are missing or unknown) are the empty string (!''); other non-required fields which have no data are null. Required fields have the constraint that they are not null. [[BR]] [[BR]]

    3332= Task 2: Setup Apache Tomcat =
    … …  
    3635Download and install the latest Apache Tomcat from https://tomcat.apache.org/download-80.cgi#8.5.24 on your development machine. Go to "8.5.24" -> "Binary Distributions" -> "Core", for Mac and Linux, download the "zip" file, for Windows, download the "32-bit or 64-bit Windows zip".Unzip the downloaded file.
    3736
    38 To start the Tomcat server, go to the "bin" folder,
    39 For Windows users, run "startup.bat".
    40 For Mac/Linux users, run "startup.sh". If you encounter errors, you may need to give permission to them: "sudo chmod +x *.sh"
     37To start the Tomcat server, go to the "bin" folder, For Windows users, run "startup.bat". For Mac/Linux users, run "startup.sh". If you encounter errors, you may need to give permission to them: "sudo chmod +x *.sh"

    4845= Task 2.5: Apache Tomcat Eclipse Integration (Highly Recommended) =
    49 Apache Tomcat makes hosting your applications easy. The Eclipse IDE makes development easy. Important: You may use Eclipse version 3.1 or higher.
    50 We recommend you to use Eclipse EE (EE stands for Enterprise Edition and has built-in support for application and web servers including Tomcat)
     46Apache Tomcat makes hosting your applications easy. The Eclipse IDE makes development easy. Important: You may use Eclipse version 3.1 or higher.  We recommend you to use Eclipse EE (EE stands for Enterprise Edition and has built-in support for application and web servers including Tomcat)

    8783
    8884= Task 4: Join Github Organization and create a repo for your team. =
    89 '''TODO'''
     85This course uses Github for version control. The students are expected to use Github as explained below.
     86
     87 * Students will need to signup on Github. After signing up they need to provide us their usernames and signup for teams [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1B0eu9Zt5gtaHdBFMnPnYb1mYzzpBPUcEKjmeGEiRC6E/edit?usp=sharing here].
     88 * The students will be added to [https://github.com/UCI-Chenli-teaching UCI-Chenli-teaching repository].
     89 * One member from each team will create a private repository there. The repository name should be of the form 'cs122b-winter18-team-x' where x is your team number. Other members can then be added to the repository as collaborators (by following steps given [https://help.github.com/articles/inviting-collaborators-to-a-personal-repository/ here]).
     90 * You can then begin with your project.
     91
     92  '''   Remember that we will only be checking the code in the master branch of your repository.'''
     93
     94What happens at the deadlines-
     95
     96 * On the night of the end of the grace period, we will run a GitHub script which will get the latest commit in the repository.
     97 * If the commit falls on the grace day, the team has used the grace period. If not, they haven’t. Therefore, '''if a team is not using the grace period, they are required to abstain from any checkin on the grace period day.'''
     98
     99  '''   Note that we know that there are ways to change a commit's timestamp to make it look as committed on an earlier date. However, these changes are not hidden from push events which we will be monitoring for our organisation.'''    ''   To avoid any surprises, we will be publishing the final commits that we have recorded for every team. If any team thinks we have made a mistake, they are welcome to contact us.''
     100
     101How will grading be done-
     102
     103 * The team will login to the AWS instance.
     104 * They will be required to checkout to the commit id that we have and show us their running code.

    119   '''   Each group will be assigned a unique group ID, which should be used to name your files and submission. In particular, your submission zip file should be named "project1_[2-digt-groupid].zip" For example, the file for group 9 should be "project1_09.zip". The submission should include at least one .sql file: createtable_[2-digt-groupid].sql (such as "createtable_09.sql" for group 09)  to include all the "CREATE TABLE" SQL statements.'''
